advertisement

A Penn State student found out firsthand this spring that if you think you can dance you need perseverance and talent to make it big PERIOD Casie Goshow juniorrecreation park and tourism management used her dance abilities to earn her a place at the Las Vegas auditions for the FOX reality show So You Think You Can Dance  PERIOD The show which will bring its arena tour to the Bryce Jordan Center at  p.m PERIOD Friday was casting its third season when Goshow tried out PERIOD After passing a New York audition including two trials in front of judges she was flown to Las Vegas for a second round of weeklong auditions PERIOD Goshow said she felt honored just to be chosen for the finals PERIOD she said PERIOD After a full day of rigorous activities to promote the television show and begin the audition Goshow was cut but she wasnt completely discouraged PERIOD she said PERIOD  She said she was glad to make it as far as she did and will try out again for the next season PERIOD  she said PERIOD  After a combination of public voting and input from the judges on the show 19yearold Sabra Johnson of Utah was chosen as the third seasons winner PERIOD She will be featured when she and the nine other So You Think You Can Dance finalists stop at the BJC PERIOD Goshow who saw the touring show last week in Atlantic City said the TV show doesnt compare to seeing the dancers live PERIOD  she said  Bernie Punt director of public relations at the BJC said this is the first production at the center solely featuring dance PERIOD  he said PERIOD  Punt said the performance was pushed back an hour to account for the universitys  Homecoming parade and other events this weekend PERIOD Members of the dance community at Penn State are interested in the performance including the dance minors director Elisha Clark PERIOD  she said PERIOD Clark said the dance style taught within the School of Theatre is slightly different than what is presented on the show PERIOD  she said PERIOD Clark said the show focuses more on entertainment but choreographer Mia Michaels  style helps bridge the artistic and competitive worlds PERIOD  Clark said PERIOD Clark said she is glad the show is generating interest in the art PERIOD  she said PERIOD
